page.title: 12HARDWICK PARK,SEDGEFIELD
page.content: { Hardwick Hall Country Park}is just off the A177; 2\ miles from the A1(M). Hardwick Hall Country Park has a small lake. In the lake you can catch fish tadpoles and frogs. There are signs which tell you what kind of fish you can catch. Mallard,Dabchick,Moorhen and Coot all raise their young around the lake. At a quiet part of the lake there is a hide where you can watch these water birds.There is another hide for watching woodland birds. { Hardwick's History The mediaeval manor of "Herdewyk" occupied this site in 1380.The present Hall,built in the 1750s, was surrounded by landscape gardens and a park.There is a temple on a hill and a castle gateway built as a ruin.The Hall itself is now a Hotel.
